website_summaries.verdict: Something on the smaller side for home brewing beginners or anyone wanting to keep bottles fresh.
pros: Lightweight design and materials makes it easy to keep the bottler anywhere you want
Easy to use: bottler head pushes a cap down around the lip of the bottle with ease for a good seal
cons: Bottler takes more time to seal a cap than a professional bench bottler

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I feel like this item is super self explanatory but I'll explain it anyway. It is red. It is a bottle capper. It caps bottles. You can only cap a bottle if you have bottle caps - make sure you buy those as they are NOT included. Super easy to use. Just place one of your separately purchased bottle caps into the slot of the bottle capper that has a magnet end and then place over your bottle - also NOT included. Simply squeeze the handles together and bam, your bottle is now capped.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea L

customer_reviews.title: Quality design. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I always read over customer reviews and this product ranks high for good reason. Item came packaged nicely. I used the bottle capper to cap a batch of home brew. With these it was a cinch. It surprisingly takes very little pressure to cap a bottle. Also, the tip of this is magnetic and holds the cap right where it needs to be. Great design. Quality. Will recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: I make Fallout props and reappply Nuka Cola caps and what-not and have had great results. The magnet helps a bunch in holding ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for over 2 years and with steady pressure, I haven't found anything weak about it. Doesn't require that much pressure to apply caps. I make Fallout props and reappply Nuka Cola caps and what-not and have had great results. The magnet helps a bunch in holding it center but also check eye level to make sure it all is straight so you don't waste a cap or break a glass rim!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Capper
customer_reviews.text: I like this capper because it's not finicky capping different bottles (champagne, sparkling wine, Martinellis, etc). If you're capping bottles other than easy big lipped beer bottles, you just need to use a little finesse (don't try to bring the capper ends all the way down) to make sure the cap is securely sealed. These cappers are quite versatile, but they will wear out after a few years of regular use. Also, you can break it if you try to force this capper all the way down on champagne/Martinellis/sparkling wine bottles. I would recommend using a small amount of silicon grease on the inside of the capping bell before bottling; less problems with sticking.
customer_reviews.author: Punamoke

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I read through many reviews before I settled on the Red Baron and I'm glad I did! I wasn't sure how good it would be considering the price, but it is very sturdy construction, easy to use and I'm sure it will last a long time! I bottled a batch of beers and tested it out on many bottles. All of them sealed perfectly. I just popped my first one and the carbonation is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: light

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: The very first time we used this product to cap our home made beer, and on the very first beer bottle the plastic snapped right in half, not even capping the bottle and ruining the whole experience and we were unable to bottle a single beer! Also unable to return or replace.... wonder why!!! Don’t recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: This product is a piece of garbage. I spent so many hours meticulously brewing gallons of beer all for nothing because this capper doesn’t work. There isn’t a single cap that is on straight or tight. The magnet is bent or just isn’t flat so each cap starts off at an angle. One side on each cap is flared up and clearly won’t keep the co2 contained once it builds up. I can almost pop the caps off with my thumb. If only I hasn’t bought this while my beer was fermenting I’d be able to return it. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: jtb

customer_reviews.title: So fat so good
customer_reviews.text: My husband is home brewing and he's using this to cap bottles instead of using the reusable ones that we got. He really enjoys that so far if you just follow the other reviews don't squeeze too hard it is plastic yellow snap it if you do it does not take a lot of force to use. It works really well I highly recommend it we haven't had any problems with it and it works just as it states for the bottles together with the caps on without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: I love this! It really makes it easy to bottle my kombucha!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to bottle my kombucha and I absolutely love it. I was worried that I wouldn't be able to use it because of the arthritis in my hands or because I am too short to put much pressure on it when my bottle sits on the counter. The mechanism moves so smoothly I don't have to exert a lot of pressure. I can use my palms to press down. I use a silicone trivet under the bottle to hold it in place, so it stays still and seals smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: MicroSense

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 14 bottles
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Red Baron. First one worked great Lost my other one after several moves. Item worked great for about 14 bottles then it broke. By this I mean the spring seems to have lost its tension. When I try to place the caps on the bottle they don’t crimp. The slightest pressure knocks them off. I’m going to buy another one but buyer beware . I tried to return it through amazon as I had it for 2-3 weeks before it stopped worked. however when I go through the returns process I get a message that this item is not eligible for 30 day return.
customer_reviews.author: Major Tom

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy - does not need much pressure
customer_reviews.text: I'm siding with the reviewers who claimed that the cause of these cappers breaking is user error. This thing is very sturdy, and I can't imagine it breaking under normal use. There's noticeable feedback when the cap has been fully crimped, and that's when you need to stop pressing. I over carbonated my last batch, but still none of the caps have come off. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Deeje & Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I was leary of buying these because they are made of plastic. However, I took a chance due to the ratings of others. I feel they are sturdy and still work fine after bottling 4 batches of homebrew now. I recommend this capper and would buy it again as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: MikeRigel

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, for a while.  Not durable.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job effortlessly, at first. After fewer than 150 bottles it is beginning to break down. Even though the molded plastic is hard (probably ABS) the smaller parts are breaking or deforming. I just bottled some sparkling wine and the magnet which holds caps in place came out of its molded seat. Not much chance of gluing it in place, so now I'm investigating if it can be disassembled and a new part installed, though it appears that would require removing rivets. Looking for another brand that is better made. Stick to small beer bottles to reduce stress on the mechanism. It doesn't fit as many bottle types as I believe it should.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Styler

customer_reviews.title: Broke bottles and ended up breaking apart
customer_reviews.text: The product looks robust and I was able to close 3-4 bottles without much trouble, but then, it broke one bottle while I was trying to bottle it and the broken glass with the cap got stuck to the capper. It was a bit dangerous to remove it cause it was broken glass. I managed to take it out, and then I tried bottling again, and then part of the capper got stuck to the bottle (picture). I had to throw the whole thing, cause it was impossible to remove it from the bottle and I don't think I want to use this product again... I guess you get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Z

customer_reviews.title: Best low cost cap press option by far!
customer_reviews.text: Came as expected. Thick, sturdy red plastic. No frills, and nothing complex about it. If you need to press some caps for a craft project, or are just starting out bottling your first few batches of home brew, this is probably your best bet. I tested it as soon as it arrived, and it consistently crimped each cap to standard sized beer bottles. No excessive force required. Very easy to operate. I'll update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: 1GrumpyVeteran

customer_reviews.title: Complete trash
customer_reviews.text: Complete trash. Came with rust on the presser. Only closes every other bottle properly even after a month of use and 64 bottles later. 2 month later is broke. Maybe around 100 bottles pressed.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolai

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works well for the most part.
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived in perfect condition, it's easy to use and works well non most bottles I used. I tried to use it on mas-produced pop-top beer bottles with two XX's, and the caps would not properly crimp. Not sure if it's the cap or the capper that's the issue, but it does not work for these bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 1

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use, Affordable, Tough and Durable
customer_reviews.text: Ok guys, here it is. The bottle capper of your dreams. Priced right for us weekend bottlers. Easy to work mechanism with a good lever ratio, so you don't need giant arms to get the job done. Made from really tough plastics. I've dropped mine a bunch of times and it's still working like new.

customer_reviews.title: Works good on longnecks but not shortnecked bottles

Gets this many stars because it appears to do a good job on all the long neck bottles I have.
customer_reviews.author: big_erics_books

customer_reviews.title: Works very nice to put caps on bottles
customer_reviews.text: Works very nice to put caps on bottles. Build quality is sturdy. Be careful when putting the cap, because misaligning it will cause it to be pressed with an offset and that will bend the cap. But when its aligned at the very center, it will work really well.

customer_reviews.title: Capped my 12 oz and 22 oz with no issues
customer_reviews.text: I have used this to cap a variety of 12 oz and 22 oz glass bottles. It seems to have no issues at all and has a small plastic indicator on the side that lets you know when the capper has reached the end. There is a magnetic bottle cap holder on the underside also that helps with the process. I have not had any of my beers leak while using this capper.

customer_reviews.title: Simple. Effective. Works good on most bottles.
customer_reviews.text: It works good on bottles with a expanded flare in the glass about 5/8” from the top. Some bottles you may try to reuse that came from the liquor store don’t have that low flare in the glass, and this won’t work on those. My first attempt at actual bottling was reused bottles I saved from previous beers, and some commercial breweries don’t use the type of bottle that works with this machine. Ah well. A half dozen went to the recycle bin.
customer_reviews.author: BootstrapJohnny

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed

He bottled today for the 2nd time since purchasing and was having such a hard time he had to return to using his old one. Not sure if it’s defective but he was very frustrated which is pretty upsetting since I wanted to make his bottling experience better with this purchase, not worse.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Panzarella

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great price

It works with little effort and caps the bottle very easily. Sorry for the original bad review. The problem was entirely my fault.

However, I had a batch go wrong and the bottles built up and unbelievable amount of pressure, so much so that they would explode when you opened them. Clearly this capper was able to seal the caps on there nice and tight! Would absolutely recommend, especially at this price.

customer_reviews.title: Decent

I deal with Amazon several times in a week since I live in a rural area and have never given a negative review on something, but this is terrible.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use

customer_reviews.title: It works on 8oz coke bottles and it's a good seal with no leakage
customer_reviews.text: It works on 8oz coke bottles and it's a good seal with no leakage, but it doesn't seem to get as tight as most bottles are. it's easier to pull the tops off than say, a beer. and trust me, i've pulled a lot of bottletops off of beers.

customer_reviews.title: The unit is mostly plastic but it is incredibly sturdy. I've been able to put my weight into ...

The unit is mostly plastic but it is incredibly sturdy. I've been able to put my weight into this and it hasn't budged. To top it all off (no pun intended) I have yet to have a top blow off.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Kremer

customer_reviews.title: Works great

customer_reviews.title: Very good for bottling

Some bottle types are a little bit harder to release after capping but still works. I've done seven 5 gallon batches with it so far and no problems.

customer_reviews.text: I've bottled two five gallon brews so far, with no problems.

customer_reviews.text: I've had a bottle or two slip out from under me, so make sure you are on a good surface, but other than that This capper has worked for me pretty great for the past 3 batches of cider I've made.

customer_reviews.title: Easy capper.

customer_reviews.title: Works good but takes a little more muscle than a standing capper
customer_reviews.text: Takes a bit of muscle but works well. I get a good solid seal on every bottle

customer_reviews.title: Super smooth and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Super smooth and easy to use. Great product. The "fully down" position is horizontal, and the capping motion is almost too easy, so I see why other people were able to break it by pushing down too far or too hard.

customer_reviews.title: Good enough.

customer_reviews.title: Good first time brewer piece
customer_reviews.text: I'm a first time brewer. For the price point, this thing did the trick and I had no issues when bottling. Nothing fancy; but it works; and did not crack my bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle K.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for quick and easy bottle capping.

customer_reviews.title: No issues and have already capped over 100 bottles.

customer_reviews.title: mediocre quality and not fool-proof
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived with plastic guide on one side slightly dinged. If you press down too soon before squeezing inward the handle/levers will catch on these plastic guides and continue to wear them away. The design could be improved by making these guides curved so they guide the levers inward to the center from the start. Also, the bell at the top where the cap is seated has a good bit of tolerance, so it's easy to get caps off-center. It does what it's supposed to, but you must use it with care.
